BASEBALL

American League CLEVELAND INDIANS--Signed 3B Dave Hollins to a minor league contract and assigned him to Buffalo of the International League. KANSAS CITY ROYALS--Acquired INF Wilson Delgado from the New York Yankees for SS Nick Ortiz. Optioned OF Scott Pose to Omaha of the PCL and LHP Tim Byrdak to Wichita of the Texas League. Purchased the contract of LHP Paul Spoljaric from Omaha. Transferred RHP Orber Moreno from the 15- to the 60-day disabled list. NEW YORK YANKEES--Placed LHP Allen Watson on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled LHP Randy Choate from Columbus of the International League.

National League PITTSBURGH PIRATES--Activated RHP Todd Ritchie from the 15-day disabled list. Placed RHP Francisco Cordova and LHP Chris Peters on the 15-day disabled list. Recalled LHP Jeff Wallace from Nashville of the PCL.
BASKETBALL

National Basketball Association DETROIT PISTONS--Re-signed G-F Jud Buechler and C Mikki Moore. Signed F Torraye Braggs. MILWAUKEE BUCKS--Signed F Darvin Ham to a two-year contract. NEW JERSEY NETS--Signed G-F Kendall Gill to a one-year contract. ORLANDO MAGIC--Signed F Mike Miller to a four-year contract. SAN ANTONIO SPURS--Signed F Ira Newble and C Shawnelle Scott. TORONTO RAPTORS--Signed G Mark Jackson to a four-year contract. UTAH JAZZ--Agreed to terms with F Danny Manning on a two-year contract. WASHINGTON WIZARDS--Re-signed C Jahidi White, G Chris Whitney and G Laron Profit.

Women's National Basketball Association MIAMI SOL--Announced the retirement of Sharon Manning to become women's assistant basketball coach at St. Joseph's, Pa. International Basketball League LAS VEGAS BANDITS--Named Jan Williams director of promotions and special events.
FOOTBALL
National Football League JACKSONVILLE JAGUARS--Signed DE Tony Brackens to a one-year contract. Xtreme Football League
HARNESS RACING
MID-STATE RACEWAY--Named Pat J. Bombardo chief operating officer.
HOCKEY

National Hockey League ATLANTA THRASHERS--Agreed to terms with F Steve Guolla. CALGARY FLAMES--Named Greg Gilbert assistant coach. DALLAS STARS--Acquired RW David Ling from the Chicago Blackhawks for future considerations. EDMONTON OILERS--Announced the resignation of Doug Piper, executive vice president of business operations. TORONTO MAPLE LEAFS--Re-signed D Danny Markov.
East Coast Hockey League FLORENCE PEE DEE PRIDE--Traded F Buddy Smith to the Wheeling Nailers for F Curtis Wilgosh.

United Hockey League LEHIGH VALLEY XTREME--Announced the postponement of the team's inaugural season until 2001-02. MUSKEGON FURY--Announced Rich Komm will return for the 2000-01 season as director of hockey operations-coach.
West Coast Hockey League FRESNO FALCONS--Announced the retirement of G Jeff Ferguson.
Western Professional Hockey League LAKE CHARLES ICE PIRATES--Re-signed C Clint Wensley.
COLLEGE

ALABAMA--Named John Hayden assistant media relations director. BAYLOR--Signed baseball coach Steve Smith to a contract extension. CALDWELL--Named Chris Reardon baseball coach and Timothy Nellegar men's assistant basketball coach. Announced the resignation of Joe Scott, men's assistant basketball coach. CURRY--Named Herb Chenell women's tennis coach. DRAKE--Named Ray Hansen interim volleyball coach and Tina Harding assistant volleyball coach. EASTERN KENTUCKY--Announced basketball sophomore Rick Jones will leave the school. FAIRLEIGH DICKINSON--Named Bob Boyle director of athletic communications and marketing. FRANKLIN & MARSHALL--Named Erika Habersaat assistant director of sports information. GEORGETOWN--Announced the resignation of Robert Bell, athletic director. IOWA--Named Larissa Libby women's assistant gymnastics coach. KINGS POINT--Named Heather Stone softball coach and events coordinator. MANHATTAN--Announced the resignation of Leonard Kaplan, assistant athletic director, to become senior administrator for athletics, physical education, intramurals and recreation at the New Jersey Institute of Technology. MIAMI--Named Dwight Freeman, Greg Gary and Brock Kantrow men's assistant basketball coaches. Signed Amy Deem, women's track coach, to a three-year contract. MISSISSIPPI VALLEY STATE--Named Doug Shanks baseball coach. NEW HAVEN--Named Cristina Lukas women's softball coach. RICE--Named Mike Taylor and Rusty Pendergrass assistant baseball coaches. SOUTHEASTERN LOUISIANA--Named John Cox and Janice Jabido women's assistant soccer coaches. TEXAS--Named KayLinda Crawford women's assistant golf coach. TOLEDO--Named Jeff Westmeyer men's and women's assistant tennis coach. UTAH--Agreed to terms with Ron McBride football coach on a four-year contract extension.
